Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: Consultant with the Department of Personnel Planning, US Navy San Diego.
Graduated three PhD students. Currently directing the theses of two PhD students.

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Workshop on Quantitative Finance, Rimini, Italy, Member of Scientific Committee
Workshop on Quantitative Finance, Florence, Italy. Member of scientific committee
Workshop on Quantitative Finance, Parma, Italy, Member of Scientific Committee.
EURO Conference on Operations Research, Poznan, Poland, Member of Scientific Committee.
Workshop on Quantitative Finance, Pisa, Italy, Member of Scientific Committee
Workshop on Quantitative Finance, Milan, Italy, Member of Scientific Committee.
Workshop on Quantitative Finance, Univ. of Roma III, Member of Scientific Committee

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Associate editor, Computational Management Science, Springer Verlag
Associate editor, EURO Journal on Computational Optimization, Springer Verlag.
Topical editor, financial applications, Wiley Encyclopedia of Operations Research and Management Science.

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: Letter of commendation (third prize) at the annual doctoral thesis competition of the Transportation Science section of the Operations Research Society of America.
Young researcher encouragement prize, given by TUBITAK (the turkish equivalent of CNR).
Third prize at the Robert Faure Competition of the French Operations Research Society for the entire body of research work (given to researchers less than 36 years of age), 1999-2000.

Partecipazione al collegio dei docenti o.content: Membro del collegio dottorale, Dipartimento di Scienze dell'informatica e matematica, Univ. of L'Aquila.
Visiting professor teaching a 18 hour doctoral course at the Univ of Milano, Bicocca on Optimization: Theory and Algorithms at the Department of Statistics and Quantitative Methods.
Visiting professor teaching a 21 hour doctoral course at Univ of Milano, Bicocca on Optimization: Theory and Algorithms.

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Research Fellow at Department of Operations Research and Financial Engineering, Princeton University

I taught twice a doctoral level course (21 hours) on Non-linear Optimization at University of Milano, Bicocca upon invitation of Profs Fabio Bellini and Profssa Monica Bianchi. This year I taught a doctoral level course on Combinatorial and Robust Optimization at the same institution.
I taught a Master level course at the Univ. of L'Aquila in the fall semester 2017-2018 on ``Mathematical Optimization in Engineering''
I taught a doctoral level course (21 hours) on Non-linear Optimization at University Roma III upon invitation by Prof. Francesco Cesarone.

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: Research grant from CNR-TUBITAK with the group of late Prof. Francesco Maffioli, Politecnico di Milano, Department of Electronics and Information: Dimensioning of communication networks under demand uncertainty.
Collaboration with the research group of Prof. Claudio Arbib, Univ of l'Aquila, Department of Computer Science.
Collaboration With Prof. Fabio Antonelli of University of L'Aquila on the project ''Calibrated American Option Pricing''.
Collaboration with Prof.essa Sara Biagini at the University of Pisa on Pricing of Options in Mathematical Finance.
Collaboration with Univ. of Rome II, Tor Vergata, Prof. Stefano Herzel, on the project "Socially responsible investment, delegated portfolio optimization".

Responsabilita' scientifica per progetti.content: NATO Collaborative Research Grant with Washington State University, Professor Bintong Chen. Solution of linear, nonlinear programming, and complementarity problems by smoothing methods
